content: biffer shrug from gherkin s bucket materials size h us 8 crochet hook 1 3/4 oz worsted weight kitchen cotton i used sugar n cream abbreviations bpdc - back post double_crochet chain - chain double_crochet - double_crochet fpdc - front post double_crochet half_double_crochet - half_double_crochet half_double_crochet decrease - half_double_crochet decrease rem - remaining slip_stitch - slip_stitch pattern chain 17 row 1 - half_double_crochet in 3rd chain from hook half_double_crochet in each rem chain across turn row 2-7 - chain 2 counts as first st half_double_crochet in each half_double_crochet across turn 16 half_double_crochet row 8 - chain 3 counts as first st 1 double_crochet in same half_double_crochet 1 double_crochet in each half_double_crochet across until last half_double_crochet 2 double_crochet in last half_double_crochet turn 18 double_crochet row 9-30 - chain 2 counts as first st alternate fpdc and bpdc across until last double_crochet 1 half_double_crochet in last st turn row 31 - chain 2 counts as first st half_double_crochet decrease over next two sts half_double_crochet across until last 2 sts half_double_crochet decrease over last 2 sts turn 16 half_double_crochet copyright krysten l & gherkin s bucket 2007 don t steal my stuff y all it s for personal use only to bring joy to others give credit where credit is due selling the finished product for non-profit charity uses is ok row 32-37 - chain 2 counts as first st half_double_crochet in each half_double_crochet across turn fasten_off fold each half_double_crochet section over onto the double_crochet section and slip_stitch both thicknesses together in order to make the pockets on each side that hold the shrug onto the mop head slip it onto your swiffer and be proud of yourself when one side is dirty flip the pockets inside-out and use what was the back to keep going the alternating front and back post stitches ensure that there are ridges on both sides you can also purchase these pre-made through my etsy shop for those of you who are less than crochet-inclined www gherkinsbucket etsy com copyright krysten l & gherkin s bucket 2007 don t steal my stuff y all it s for personal use only to bring joy to others give credit where credit is due selling the finished product for non-profit charity uses is ok
